The China-Myanmar Friendship Scholarship Project is funded by the Chinese Embassy in Myanmar and implemented by the CFPA Myanmar Office. The project is especially designed to advance educational cooperation between China and Myanmar, and provides financial support for students with financial difficulties to complete their studies.

cn: 山地部落教师及青少年汉语学习计划
en: Chinese Language Project for Hill Tribe Teachers & Youth
introduction: In order to strengthen the level of Chinese language teaching in northern Thailand, Sichuan Haihui together with the True Sense (Thailand) Co. Ltd provide language training for teachers from Chinese schools in Northern Thailand. Adding the Sustainable Development Goals of the United Nations to the teaching material, the project attracts youth from the cities and hill tribes to start learning Chinese. Through the project, Chinese culture is promoted and communications between China and Thailand are further enhanced.
In cooperation with the Less Walk organization and CFPA, the Love Bike Donation Program intends to help students to have better transportation to go to school.

The Mekong River Sun Village project provides sustainable solar power solutions to improve energy access and economic growth in underserved Mekong River regions, with successful installations benefiting thousands in Cambodia and Myanmar.

To improve the basic learning conditions of primary school students in need in beneficiary countries and to assist in comprehensive education, as well as to convey Chinese people’s kindness, to encourage people-to-people connectivity, and to deepen friendship between China and other countries, the China Foundation for Poverty Alleviation and Alibaba Philanthropy jointly launched the Panda Pack Project on February 26th 2019. With the theme of “Gifts from Panda Land”, the design of the Panda Packs integrates various natural and cultural elements, both of China and of the destination country, and uses the local language for explanatory content, extending friendly greetings to the students receiving the packs.
